dialogues.Winston:
[1] He ENTERS with sleeves rolled up, wiping a plate with a dish towel and wearing an apron.  
[2]			 		Nevermind, Egon, wouldn't want you to 		strain yourself. 			 		Ghostbusters Central.  
[3]		Calm down... Where are you?... 			 		We'll be right there.  He hangs up.  
[4]		Ready for this one?  Some farmer says his 		wife was eaten by a giant chicken.  
[5] Driving.  
[6]		But wouldn't it be somethin' if he sells 		that weather balloon idea of his?  He'll be 		a rich man!  
[7]		Shouldn't be hard to find.  
[8]		A werechicken?  
[9]		Let's get it back to Headquarters and run 		some tests.  Then maybe we'll have some 		answers.  
[10]			 		Ray, it's gettin' pretty late.  Maybe there 		really isn't any...  
[11]			 		Then let's get it!  
[12] They ENTER cautiously, Ray holding his BEEPING meter out before him.  The barn is dark except for the moonlight slanting through the loft window and the beams of their flashlights.  As the WIND picks up, WOOD CREAKS, HAY RUSTLES, and a piece of JUNKY machinery turns with a SQUEAL.  
[13]			 		Man, this place is creepy.  
[14]		Look out!  Ray shines his flashlight toward the lofts.  Its beam catches a couple of startled pigeons as they fly out the window, pinion feathers WHISTLING.  
[15] 				RAY & WINSTON 			  
[16] They stop as PKE meter starts BEEPING.  Ray checks the reading.  
[17]		Man, he is ugly!  
[18]		Hang on!  That's it!  
[19] A normal chicken with singed feathers stands where the Werechicken was. It CLUCKS, starts pecking at the dirt.  
[20]		Ray, I just had a thought...  Ray pauses to look around at Winston.  
[21]		What if that six-foot werechicken is Zeke's 		wife?  And off their looks, we --  
[22]			 		What happened?  He's so quiet all of a 		sudden.  
[23] 
[24]		You've been turned into a werechicken!  
[25] 
[26]		We're too late!  
[27] They stare, wide-eyed.  After A BEAT --  
[28] looking around.  
[29]		What was that?  
[30]			 		No pun intended.  
[31]		That's it!  Winston cranks the wheel.  
[32]		Ten feet tall?  
[33]		How could we lose a fifteen foot-tall 		chicken?  
[34]		Thirty feet tall?  
[35] Ray tosses out the trap.  
[36] Being buffeted by wind, struggling to hang onto their throwers as they continue firing.  They have to SHOUT over the NOISE.  
[37]			 		Trap's full!  Somebody forgot to empty it!  
[38] turn to each other.  
[39]
[40]			 		Peter, get outa here!  It banks, gets the hell away.  
[41] turn off their proton guns and are KNOCKED down by the released force as the freed Monstrous Spirit whooshes skyward.  The STORM abruptly disappears, as if SUCKED up.  The trap stops shaking and SNAPS shut.  
[42]		Yeah, but how do you freeze a 50-foot 		chicken in August?  A BEAT, then the three guys look at each other.  				RAY, WINSTON & PETER 		Egon's weather balloon!  
[43] On street below, looking skyward through binoculars.  
[44]		What's it doing?  
[45]			 		I don't want to hear it.  
[46]		They did it!  All-right!!  They high-five each other.  
[47]		Uh-oh.  
[48]			 		It's just Slimer groovin' to his new James 		Brown tape.
dialogues.Janine:
[1]			  
[2]		Egon!  What happened?  
[3] She stares at Egon, totally bewildered.  
[4]		But what ...? 			 		Nevermind.  
[5]		Are you sure you wanna go to a meeting like 		-- this?  
[6] Staring after him in disbelief.
